description.narrative: Enabling environment for Slovak private companies to contribute to Slovakia’s international development cooperation strengthened

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative:
1.1 Number of events aiming to raise the awareness of the Slovak business sector around opportunities and modalities to get engaged in development cooperation in targeted priority countries 1.2. Number of facilitation field missions (to identify priority areas, to match potential business partners, to identify relevant partners in beneficiary countries, etc.) 1.3. Number of training/coaching sessions for Slovak companies and investors (number of participating companies/investors) to make their business models more sustainable, encourage their participation in the implementation of development cooperation projects and other capacity building needs as required. 1.4. Number of position papers, policy briefs, guidelines and other instruments as needed to improve and mainstream private sector engagement in the Slovakia’s ODA 1.5. Number of workshop on private sector engagement in development for Slovak national partners engaged in disbursing and managing Slovakia’s ODA 1.6. Number of knowledge management resources produced documenting best practices/resources for private sector engagement in development
1.7. Number of PSE mini-projects developed and delivered with clear development outcomes
1.8. Number of advisory policy reports developed by the Energy Hub 1.9. Extent to which the national beneficiaries are satisfied with the policy advice provided by the Energy Hub (Scale1-3, where 1-not satisfied, 2 – somewhat satisfied, 3 - fully satisfied) 1.10. Ukraine Energy Efficiency Secretariat and Expert Hub is still operational (no, partially, yes)

Ukrainian Energy Efficiency Hub (EEH): 1.8 Number of advisory policy reports developed by the EEH: 0 1.9 Extent to which the national beneficiaries are satisfied with the policy advice provided by the EEH: n/a. 1.10 . Extent to which the national beneficiaries are satisfied: n/a

Note: Actual project implementation started only in October 2018 therefore the year 2018 shall be considered only as the initiation and planning stage, therefore the year 1 targets (as per the project document) refer to the year 2019
Targets: - To develop and approve the 2018 / 2018 Annual Work Plan - Implementation modalities determined
Partially achieved: 2018 / 2019 AWP prepared and agreed on with donor

Targets achieved. 1.1 One PS awareness rising event 1.2 6 facilitation field missions 1.3 30 coaching actions for the Slovak companies and investors 1.4 8 position papers, policy briefs, guidelines for Slovak ODA actors 1.5 4 workshops for Slovak ODA actors 1.6 2 knowledge management resources 1.7 Slovak Challenge Fund (SCF) launched 1.8 4 advisory policy reports developed by the Ukraine Energy Hub 1.9 Ukraine national beneficiaries are fully satisfied with the policy advice provided by the Energy Hub 1.10 Ukraine Energy Efficiency Secretariat and Expert Hub is still operational
